title: AI Disruption Principles & GPT-Notion Automation Workflow
summary: A strategic guide on navigating the AI revolution using the 'John vs. Sarah' analogy, accompanied by a technical breakdown of building a GPT-powered Notion auto-tweeting agent. The workflow demonstrates integrating Python, Notion, and OpenAI to automate social media content creation with human oversight.

steps.reasoning: Create core functions (parse_turbo_response, tweet_get_params) to interface with OpenAI and Twitter APIs.
Establish a structured database to act as the agent's state manager, tracking tweets, hashtags, and delivery status.
Review AI-generated content manually to approve or reject posts before final execution, ensuring quality control.
Host the application logic and establish connectivity with the external publishing platform.
Run the orchestration script that reads the approved state from Notion and triggers the tweet publication.

steps.action: Apply Principle: Run In, Not Out
steps.reasoning: Strategic step to adopt new AI models immediately to gain a competitive advantage rather than resisting change.

key_takeaways: Principle 1: 'Run In, Not Out' - Embrace disruptive technologies immediately to avoid obsolescence.
Principle 2: 'More With Less' - Use AI as a lever to achieve 10x output (e.g., 30 mins work for 2 hours output).
Principle 3: 'Bet on Always' - Focus on fundamental human needs (speed, connection, lower cost) when building AI products.
Avoid building simple UI wrappers around ChatGPT; focus on deep integration that provides significant leverage.
